body:
The field of Democrats mulling a run to succeed Senator Barbara Boxer just got a little smaller.

Antonio R. Villaraigosa, the former mayor of Los Angeles, said Tuesday that he would not be run for the Senate in 2016.

“As I think about how best to serve the people of this great state, I know that my heart and my family are here in California, not in Washington, D.C.,” he said in a statement.

Mr. Villaraigosa’s decision follows similar announcements last month from Tom Steyer, the billionaire environmentalist, and Lt. Gov. Gavin Newsom.

That leaves Kamala D. Harris, the state’s attorney general, as a favorite to succeed Ms. Boxer, who announced last month that she would not seek re-election next year.

Officials from both parties have said that a Republican would have an extremely difficult time winning the seat in overwhelmingly Democratic California. 

While Mr. Villaraigosa is not running for Senate, he has hinted at being interested in running for governor, setting up a potential contest against Mr. Newsom, who has taken steps toward a bid. 

“We have come a long way,” Mr. Villaraigosa said Tuesday, “but our work is not done, and neither am I.”
description: The field of Democrats mulling a run to succeed Senator Barbara Boxer just got a little smaller.
title: First Draft: Antonio Villaraigosa Opts Against Run for Boxer’s Senate Seat
